title: Nutanix Resiliency Threshold Alert
description: Alerts when cluster resiliency usage exceeds 75% or 90%.

definition.name: LogicInsight - Nutanix Cluster Resiliency
definition.message:
{{#is_alert}} 

Resiliency status: The cluster's resiliency is approaching critical levels.

This event indicates that the cluster is utilizing a significant portion of its capacity reserved for maintaining data redundancy.

Threshold context:

1. Above 90%: The cluster is nearing its resiliency threshold — This is a warning that if usage reaches 100%, the cluster will lose its ability to maintain full resiliency, which can be potentially dangerous in case of a node or disk failure.
2. Above 75%: The resiliency level is moderately degraded — It is recommended to evaluate the current storage usage and plan corrective actions to avoid reaching critical thresholds.

Suggested next steps:

- Assess current disk utilization and free up space if possible.
- Consider expanding cluster capacity to restore resiliency headroom.
- Investigate recent hardware failures or rebalancing delays.
- Ensure replication and redundancy tasks are progressing as expected.

Taking early action will help preserve fault tolerance and avoid disruptions in case of unexpected failures.

{{/is_alert}}

{{#is_recovery}} 

Resiliency has returned to a healthy state.

The cluster is once again operating with sufficient redundancy and protection mechanisms in place.  
Good work ensuring the environment remains resilient!

{{/is_recovery}}
